posts.content:
..You should've applied yourself to the task in hand, then; there's no point moaning about it now...






Now i have had time to reflect Tim - You are absolutely right, I feel i have let myself and everyone else down with my pi$s poor attempt at this fix'r upper. As punishment on myself and even though its only Wednesday im going to go to the local pub....

I may find someone in there that needs a small plate welding on his peugeot 106 sill or alike, which i may be able to do, unlike the mess i have created above.

Thanks kindly Dai for the offer, but as the second part of my punishment i have decided to walk to Hessisch so i wont be needing it...

Thankyou Moler - you mean the transit??

More this weekend

Mark

..make sure you take Marika's book with you to the Pub-sit in the corner with a pint & turn the pages; if that doesn't inspire you ( anew) then nothing will!..

-getton, Mate- final straight- Champagne's on me , Sat arvo, in the campsite, H-O

That gearbox definately looks like it wants to work fine and looks quite happy in there
Ive been lucky enough to see the body work come together on this over the last couple of months in the unit and belive me it looks factory fresh under there.
It will be interesting at hessich to see how many people are trying to get under it to have a look

good work mate

Sat 18th Apr: Im going to ring you this week, sort all the bits and bobs out

Im sorry Clinton, i will ring you this week - im so wrapped up in this deadline and trying to get this damn thing done, alot of things have slipped. Poor i know but i will contact you

Thanks Ben, Tim.

The bank holiday was a bit of a non event for me as i spent nearly 30 hours working on the van, its like Terminator this van - it never stops. Im nearly 2 weeks to Mot and getting my life back but what seems like an impossible amount of stuff to do.....

The list of small but time consuming jobs continued over the 3 days and i finally got all the cab with the exception of the bulkhead finished. All the beam and steering is now mostly connected, even down to split pins,new grease nipples etc. One set of front brakes in and finished,just the other side to install. Rear brake lines went in too etc etc.....
Finally got the small welding pieces finished on the drivers wheel arch and that is now ready for top coat (i ran out of paint). I modified up some bolts to match the 3 bolts original bolts for the front bumper and got that bolted on although its fairly twisted still(i will sort later on)

The original front drums had to have some major derusting work as the spare set i had had issues with the rear bearing so i was quicker to sort the originals. That now means i used original everything except the front shocks that the van had when i got it.

Anyway the list went on and on.....

Other wheel arch awaiting paint, centre shift rod to cut to length etc but nearly done. Burnt the paint a little in the corners finally fixing the seal holder channel by the lower door hinge i had forgotton.


Pass arch nearly done...


Last thing Monday -Started to try out the repaired controls bits and bobs, seemed to all fit, should get that finished tonight


Wiring Loom will be ready later this week hopefully and will be installed this sunday. Just the Bulkhead panel which fingers crossed will be with me shortly .The engine/clutch will hopefully go in next week as well as the brake flexies, master cycl and the final brake lines up front.

More tonight im afraid
Cheers

Mark
stunning work mark good luck with the mot

..just to say ( & i'm sure many more have already offered) that if you get within striking distance , but realise you're NOT gonna make the deadline- give me a bell & i'll come over for a (working) day & bolt stuff together/make coffee-whatever ; happy to work EXACTLY as instructed - this van MUST be at Hessisch

Hi Mark,

Could you tell me what spray paint have you used for the underside (over the Galvrafroid?).

ps.... looks f'in fantastic

ATB ... Chris

Thanks ever so much Tim, very very Kind. Im still very hopefull that if i keep throwing this much time at it then it will be done, im not so far now but if it comes to it - thank you.
Thanks jezek, Chris. Chris - I will drop you a pm as i have a couple of other things to ask you .

Just a quick update, no welding tonight, just solely bolting on goodies and sorting small bits and bobs. Stuff like putting passenger door handle in, gromets for the wiring.All the pedals, and then finally after all this work getting the first thing up and working (you really shouldnt get excited about stuff like this) - the handbrake. .
Cab nearly there, the steering wheel was going in but i noticed the plate under the feet has a different bolt setup to the small plate that was still stuck to the steering tube (4 captives not 3 like later ones) so i have to mod that first.


So im going to have nearly a full week on it and do the next 2 night too.
More tomorrow .

Cheers

mark

author.location: Cotswolds border, nr Stratford Upon Avon.

posts.content:
I simply dont know what I can say about this, the skill, work and faith in this project is amazing - the fact you saw it and still went ahead with it when most of us would have never thought about it........astounds me.

I take my hat of to you and look forward to seeing it finished.

Stunning
Awesome work, I bet you've looked forward to the bolting stuff on part for ages, must make a change from welding!! Best of luck for the deadline, you know where I am if you need me.

..that is a GREAT pic
..when is the MOT date?
those front underneath shots are mental! Cant wait to see more shots, you need to get some footage on to youtube of the drive to and from the MOT station!
Awesome stuff Mark! All the small stuff you're doing now is the stuff that takes way longer than you think, I'm sure you'll get it all done though! Keep it up mate
fair play dude that looks awsome
